reviews.review_msg: Knows her stuff and tries to cover as much material as  possible. However, pace of lecture sometimes too fast, slides not posted online, and some slides have too much text on them making it difficult to read. Paper (book review), tutorial participation marks, presentation on a reading,  mt, and final. Final exam questions heavily based on textbook.

Ehor Boyanowsky is a god amongst men. A ram amongst sheep. A titan amongst the meek. His lectures are enthralling, and those who fail to understand them are simply ignorant of true genius. I highly recommend taking a classany classwith Dr. Boyanowksy.

Easy upper level elective course. Only need to do a presentation and midterm then that's it! Not even a take home final is required. Participation is mandatory. Ehor is interesting and talks about his personal experience a lot. Recommended!
a great guy and great prof. I found this a great elective course to take that was super interesting.

This is the best and easiest siminar class ever! Boyanowsky makes the class very interesting, and his great sense of humor helped as well. There were only one exam, which he graded super easy. The whole class really enjoyed him as a prof.

One of the best at SFU, extremely compelling seminar, wonderful and insightful! Raises controversial issues that other profs are afraid to touch! Can't say enough great things about this class! Professor Boyanowsky is one of the best at SFU!

Aidan is the TA for this course. My friends and I took this class as we thought it would be a good elective. NO, the class is specifically for other programs because if you're a crim major you cannot take it. NOT AN ELECTIVE. SO MUCH WORk even though it's online, every week there is a tutorial which defeats the purpose. 3 credits but worth 4.
